meanings.definition: Decorative work in which enamel, glass, or gemstones are separated by strips of metal
meanings.sent1: The cloisonne vase had colorful glass pieces separated by thin metal strips.
meanings.sent2: I bought a beautiful cloisonne necklace with intricate metal designs.
meanings.sent3: The cloisonne bowl looked like a rainbow trapped in a metal cage.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a cloisonne masterpiece, each emotion separated by invisible barriers.
meanings.sent5: The cloisonne artwork shimmered in the sunlight, each color distinct and vibrant.

meanings.definition: An object decorated using the cloisonne technique
meanings.sent1: The antique shop displayed a variety of cloisonne pieces, each unique in design.
meanings.sent2: She treasured the cloisonne box her grandmother had passed down to her.
meanings.sent3: The cloisonne figurine seemed to dance in the moonlight, its colors coming to life.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a cloisonne painting, carefully crafted and full of hidden meanings.
meanings.sent5: The cloisonne teapot gleamed on the shelf, a true work of art.
